alert.note: Alert for Christian; Greene; Lawrence; Stone; Webster; Wright (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued March 24 at 2:01AM CDT until March 24 at 2:45AM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 245 AM CDT EARLY THIS MORNING FOR NORTHERN CHRISTIAN, SOUTHERN GREENE, SOUTHERN LAWRENCE, NORTHWESTERN STONE, WEBSTER AND WRIGHT COUNTIES... At 201 AM CDT, The Department of Transportation reported flooding was occuring from heavy rainfall from thunderstorms across the warned area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 3 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Law enforcement reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Springfield, Nixa, Ozark, Republic, Monett, Aurora, Marshfield, Battlefield, Strafford, Rogersville, Marionville, Clever, Seymour, Crane, Fremont Hills, Hurley, Northview, Turners, Bassville, Linden, Galloway, Rader, Odin, Boaz, Grovespring, Manes and Graff. This includes the following highways... Interstate 44 between mile markers 63 and 106. This includes the following low water crossings... Beaver Creek at Crewes Ford Road, Wilson`s Creek at Old Limey Road, Little Crane Creek at Old Wire Road, Green Valley Creek at Holder RD, Whetstone Creek at Owens Road, Elk Creek at Highway Z and James River at Bell Ford Road. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
